intro: Lepteranthus incoronatus, commonly known as the crowned leperanthus, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It grows in rocky or dry habitats and is adapted to the unique environmental conditions of its native region. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
